forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy. Low around 44, with temperatures rising to around 46 overnight. Southeast wind around 7 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 7 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph.

weather_report:
In the quiet embrace of a San Francisco night, the skies hang mostly cloudy, wrapping the city in a soft, gray blanket. As temperatures dip to a cool 44, a gentle southeastern breeze stirs the air, signaling the slow approach of morning warmth. By Saturday, the clouds will part, inviting the sun to paint the day in hues of gold and amber. The high will flirt with 58, cooling off as afternoon shadows stretch across the landscape, accompanied by a brisk south-southeast wind that promises refreshment but clings to a touch of chill.

The outlook for this Saturday, then, is one of pleasant ambivalence. While the sun aims to pierce through, there remains a likelihood of lingering fog along the horizon where the land kisses the sea. As the morning sun rises later, dressing in layers will be key—a light sweater over a comfortable tee might do, punctuated by a scarf to fend off the cooler gusts. With such conditions, an invigorating stroll through Golden Gate Park or a quiet sit along the waterfront could rejuvenate the spirit. A visit to an art exhibit might also pleasantly complement the artistic backdrop of shifting skies and unfolding day. In this mercurial embrace of weather, there's a thoughtful beauty to be found—a reminder to savor the transient moments that make life in this city uniquely captivating.
